name: Updated ADB to 1.0.36
body: If you work with ADB from the command line, and if you've updated that ADB to 1.0.36, you need this version. If you don't, you probably don't.

name: AndroidTool 1.65
body: - Fixed a bug where the animated GIF wouldn't be created, even though "Also make a GIF" was checked

name: Android Tool
body:
- You can now press shift-cmd-o to open the terminal output window
- Fixed a bug where some OBBs would be renamed incorrectly

name: Android Tool
body: - Fixed a bug where OBB files would not be installed if running a release build

name: Android Tool 1.6
body:
- OBB file support for sideloading apps with a lot of data, typically games. 
- Simply drag the OBB file onto a device. 
- Don't forget to install the corresponding APK first

name: Android Tool 1.56
body: It's the sideloader release! - Opens a newly installed app immediately after installing - Shows an uninstall button immediately after installing - When dragging an Apk onto a device, the app now shows the app's icon, version and package name - Installs image files packed as a Zip file (fastboot update) - Preference to enable animated GIF when creating a screen recording ![installinstagram](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1548468/11649915/e85cace2-9d38-11e5-9672-9fb3e19fa8fc.gif) Known issues - iOS 9 doesn't seem to play nice with screenshots. Anyone familiar with the libimobiledevice libraries? Could be a simple update This software uses code of FFmpeg licensed under the LGPLv2.1 and its source can be downloaded here

name: Android Tool 1.51
body: - Fixed a bug where attaching an iOS device would crash Android Tool. Thanks @arjenvr!

name: Android Tool 1.5
body: - Finally! Select which folder to save your screenshots and screen recordings to (tested for Android, untested for iOS, please report back) - On Android, you can now use the current activity's name as the screenshot filename (would be even better to fetch the application label, but how?)

name: Android Tool 1.42
body:
- You can now install apps by dragging APKs directly onto the phone or watch in the app
- Fixed a bug when installing apps by dragging onto the dock icon and double clicking

![recorder](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1548468/11388041/2bf2ba62-92e6-11e5-98fb-61197b21e24d.gif)

name: Android Tool 1.4
body:
- Demo mode for Android (Marshmallow and up). Change time and other status bar icons
- A status label so you can see what's going on
- A shell console output window so you can see what's really going on 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1548468/11384278/6ad77eb6-92c3-11e5-95fa-4a264b8ec39c.png)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1548468/11384303/865bf964-92c3-11e5-9a2a-4fd6a8c48990.png)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1548468/11384311/90eec186-92c3-11e5-8225-6a92454efeed.png)

name: Android Tool 1.3
body: Huge thanks to the AndroidTool community for the by far majority of contributions in this release. - Significant screenshot speed improvements - ADB over Bluetooth support (more) - Migrated to Swift 2 - Screen recording improvements - Device connection improvements - Improved window dragging in El Capitan - Logo added for Tag Heuer watches

name: Android Tool 1.2 with experimental iOS support
body: New in this version - iOS screenshots (experimental) (sets time to 9:41, removes carrier, and shows full battery) - iOS screen MOV/GIF recordings (experimental) - User preferences for custom bitrates and scaling - Recording in portrait mode - Android emulator support Known issues - Some devices don't seem to handle video scaling well. If you're seeing garbled video, set the scale back to 1x in Preferences and open an issue - iOS screen recordings are not affected by preferences yet _Screen recording on an iPod touch, playing the movie file and dragging the gif into a Google Docs document_ *Taking screenshots of Android phones and iPhones side by side

name: Android Tool 1.17
body: Adds limited support for emulators; pulling bug reports and other custom scripts. Screencaps turn out empty.

name: Android Tool 1.16
body:
- Mavericks support (tested with Sony Smartwatch 3 and Nexus 6)
- Fixed a bug where the app would crash as a device or emulator comes online
- Fixed a bug where the spinner wouldn't appear when installing an apk package, thanks @prt2121
- Fixed a bug where the device name could cause a crash when installing an apk, thanks @prt2121

name: Android Tool 1.15
body:
release notes
- Fixed a bug where video captures on LG G Watch came out garbled
- Added a manual refresh menu item under "Tools" in the main menu
- Now updates the device list when in the background, but at a lower speed

Still known issues on OSX 10.9

name: Android Tool 1.14
body: Fixes a bug that makes the app crash if there is no internet connection (used to check for latest version)

name: Android Tool 1.1
body:
First release
- Screenshots
- Screen videos
- APK installation
- Bug reports
- Custom scripts
